channel.title: 3mpwr App - Curated Disability News
channel.description: Daily curated news on disability rights, accessibility, and benefits across Canada

item.title: Can the federal budget reset Canada's economy?
item.description: Canada's economy is suffering. The Bank of Canada says interest rate cuts can only do so much. So it's passed the baton to the federal government. This week's budget can do what the central bank cannot: restructure how the Canadian economy grows.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Canada collected $3B from U.S. counter-tariffs before a majority were dropped
item.description: Canada had collected more than $3 billion through U.S. counter-tariffs before removing a swath of levies in September, according to the Finance Department — far less than what the Liberals had promised to rake in during the current fiscal year.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Soraya Martinez Ferrada is Montreal's next mayor, CBC News projects
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Former federal minister Soraya Martinez Ferrada elected mayor of Montreal
item.description: Montreal's new mayor has pledged to tackle homelessness and to audit the city's bike paths, which have sparked a backlash from some drivers and business owners.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: 'We'll be back': What's next for the Blue Jays after heartbreaking World Series loss?
item.description: While the Blue Jays heal physically, general manager Ross Atkins has some work to do too. Several key players from Toronto's playoff run are set to become free agents in the off-season.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Toronto transit services under fire for not extending service following World Series Game 7
item.description: Toronto public transit services and politicians are facing backlash on social media following Game 7 of the World Series because some transit services were not extended past 1:30 a.m.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Albertans shouldn't expect a ‘general strike' anytime soon
item.description: While Alberta labour groups promised swift retribution after the province forced teachers back to work, the head of the union admits a general strike won't happen overnight.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: CPKC train derails near B.C. community, officials say no danger to water system
item.description: The Canadian Pacific Kansas City railway company says a locomotive and several cars, some with fuel, derailed on Saturday. TNRD officials say clean-up efforts are underway.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Say Hi to Tech Bro Carney
item.description: As his government heedlessly embraces artificial intelligence, the threats to Canadians are clear.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: After World Series loss, what's next for the Toronto Blue Jays?
item.description: Following the Toronto Blue Jays' heartbreaking Game 7 loss, some of the players are set to become free agents in the off-season, so what's next for the team.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Newfoundland's Between Breaths makes Western Canadian debut at the Firehall

item.title: Bruno Marchand wins second term as mayor of Quebec City
item.description: As the incumbent mayor, Marchand had to defend his record against attacks from his opponents during the campaign.

item.title: Alberta hunter recalls own grizzly bear close call, urges hunting safety
item.description: A hunter is recalling how he was almost attacked by a grizzly bear in Alberta six years ago in the same location where another man was attacked earlier this week.

item.title: Suki’s: Fifty-four years of style, education, and legacy
item.description: For 54 years, Suki’s has shaped Vancouver’s hair culture through artistry and education. Named Best Salon in the Georgia Straight’s Best of Vancouver 2025, the iconic brand continues to set the standard for innovation, collaboration, and timeless style—from its world-class Academy to its visionary team.

item.title: Man charged in fatal shooting at SUV
item.description: Police in Saskatchewan say a man has been charged in a September shooting on a stretch of highway that claimed the life of Tanya Myers, a passenger in an SUV.

item.title: Dusty duffel bag found in Italy revives story of Cape Bretoner killed in WW II
item.description: Michele Facchini, a Second World War researcher, found a duffel bag of a Cape Breton soldier in Italy. With it, Facchini unearthed the story of Hector Colin McDonald.
